hypothesis: H3_P2: Content embeddings improve recommendation quality for cold-start items under explicit feedback

details: CF-only models completely fail to rank cold-start items (NDCG@10 = 0 for all seeds).
Hybrid models achieve meaningful ranking quality on a subset of random seeds.
Positive effects of content embeddings emerge when validation positives are present.
The impact of content features exhibits high variance due to extreme sparsity and limited supervision.
Explicit feedback signals lead to faster convergence but amplify variance across seeds.

notes.training_time: Significantly faster than H3 due to smaller interaction matrix and reduced item set.
notes.stability: High variance across seeds indicates sensitivity to data subsampling and initialization.
notes.practical_implication: Content embeddings are necessary but not sufficient for stable cold-start item recommendation under explicit-only feedback.
